Description: Westar Energy agreed to spend approximately $500 million to significantly reduce harmful air pollution from a Kansas power plant and pay a $3 million civil penalty, under a settlement to resolve violations of the Clean Air Act. As part of the settlement, Westar was required to spend $6 million on environmental mitigation projects.
Agency: Environmental Protection Agency referral to the Justice Department

Private Litigation Case Title: Itteilag v. Aquila, Inc. et al
In re: Westar Energy ERISA Litigation
